description:
Junior Data Analyst Description/Job Summary

Simpson Thacher’s Junior Data Analyst supports the Firm’s efforts to turn raw data into information, insight and discrete solutions for our lawyers, clients and operational support staff. This resource will provide tactical support to the group, create documentation, improve quality control in delivered solutions, migrate data solutions between environments, and conduct discrete analysis.

The Junior Data Analyst position sits within the Firm’s Data Analytics Group, which is a part of the Firm’s Knowledge Department. The Knowledge Department’s mission is to improve client value, efficiency and professional satisfaction by streamlining processes, capturing and leveraging the Firm’s knowledge, by turning matter data into useful insights, and by helping lawyers find documents and information faster.

Responsibilities/Duties


Work with Firm operations, practice groups and Knowledge teams to capitalize on opportunities to leverage data to drive strategic decision making and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Firm
Conduct thorough technical analysis related to data-oriented projects, including developing documentation that captures data flow across systems, desired functionality, interface design and other functional specifications
Help assess data quality, diagnose inconsistencies in formulas and measures in reports, and ensure functional requirements are satisfied for custom solutions
Develop protocols and documentation to help ensure go-forward support of complex solutions and deliverables
Conduct analysis for and contribute to the Firm’s data governance initiatives
Assist in developing processes and sequences for moving solutions from on-prem to Azure and help execute that migration
Provide periodic reporting on solution usage and corresponding user demographics
Handle projects on request under the direction of the Director of Data Analytics, Manager of Data Analytics and other executive staff


Required Skills


Familiarity with enterprise data visualization platforms a plus (e.g. MS Power BI, Tableau)
Willing to learn SQL and SQL Server Management Studio
Willing to learn MS Azure and Power BI Online mechanics
Open to learning Python and / or other statistical programming languages
Ability to translate business problems into technical requirements
Able to communicate complex results clearly to a non-technical audience
Curious, detail-oriented and pragmatic


Required Education


A bachelor’s degree required, preferably in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering or finance


Details

Salary Information

NY only: The estimated base salary range for this position is $80k to $100k at the time of posting.

The actual salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and if applicable, the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

Privacy Notice

For information about how Simpson Thacher & Bartlett LLP collects and processes your personal information, please refer to our Privacy Notice available at https://www.stblaw.com/other/privacy-notice .


Show more
title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
Atria Wealth Solutions, Inc. (Atria) is a wealth management solution holding company focused on delivering a clear path to the future of financial advice for financial professionals, financial institutions, and their clients. Headquartered in New York City, Atria’s broker-dealer and investment adviser subsidiaries empower financial institutions and independent financial professionals with a sophisticated set of tools, services, and capabilities that deepen client relationships and maximize efficiencies in their practices.

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our amazing platform team. This position is responsible for performing data delivery and quality analysis and support for requirements and testing on efforts to grow and optimize our advisor workstation. The Junior Data Analyst responsibilities will include migrating third party CRM data to advisor’s workstation CRM and assisting Senior Data analysts with data comparison, manipulation, and analysis.

Location: This position may be done HYBRID out of one the following home office locations or fully remote:


Houston, TX: 11740 Katy Freeway, Energy Tower III Ste 600, 77079
San Diego, CA: 10150 Meanley Drive, San Diego 92131
Syracuse, NY: 100 Madison Street, Syracuse 13202
Fully Remote - USA


Salary: The anticipated annual base salary range for this position is $55,000 to $62,000. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

What you will do:


Data Delivery Analysis
Provide research and support for all in-bound & out-bound files.
Identify, communicate, and resolve data quality and delivery issues with data providers.
Provide testing support for all in-bound and out-bound files.
Monitor daily data delivery and ETL jobs.
Data Quality Analysis
Monitor data quality alerts and conduct data analysis on the alert outputs
Extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Ad-hoc SQL queries to support data analysis
Perform data reconciliations and support resolution of discrepancies
QA and UAT test of system changes
Migrating Third Party CRM Data to Advisor Workstation CRM (Unio)
Formulate a CRM data migration plan with Advisors.
Conduct data extraction from 3rd Party CRM.
Perform data clean up.
Work with developers to upload data to staging and production site.
Conduct testing in staging environment.
Provide updates and host meetings with advisors during data transition.
Manage, develop, and maintain reports for use by various departments.
Assist Senior Data Analysts with:
Data Comparison
Data Import / Export
Data Clean up
Data Entry

Must haves:


Bachelor's Degree in or equivalent work experience
2+ years of experience working data in business environment
Proficiency in SQL, MS Office products, specifically Excel
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong attention to details
Experience with business intelligence tools
Strong oral communication skills
Strong written communication skills
Strong data entry/keyboard typing skills
Self-motivated, demonstrate high level of initiative


Why work at Atria?

In addition to a competitive salary, we provide a full benefits package that includes:


Medical & Prescription Drug Insurance
Health Advocacy
Telehealth
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Health Savings Account
Flexible Spending Accounts
Short-Term Disability Insurance
Long-Term Disability Insurance
Life Insurance
Paid time off, Paid Holiday, Paid Birthday
Critical Illness, Accident & Hospital Indemnity Coverage
Identity Theft
Employee Assistance Program
Pet Insurance
Legal Plans
Virtual Therapy
Virtual Mental WellCare
Long-Term Care
Retirement 401(k) Savings Plan with matching


At Atria, we consider Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging to be essential to our success, and we are working to integrate it into the fabric of our organization. Our commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging is key to our culture and values, and critical for great products, and satisfied customers.

Atria Wealth Solutions, Inc. (Atria) is a wealth management solutions holding company focused on delivering a clear path to the future of financial advice for financial professionals, financial institutions and their clients. Headquartered in New York City, Atria’s broker-dealer subsidiaries empower financial institutions and independent financial professionals with a sophisticated set of tools, services, and capabilities that deepen client relationships and maximize efficiencies in their practices.

Atria’s broker-dealer subsidiaries include CUSO Financial Services, L.P., Sorrento Pacific Financial, LLC, Cadaret Grant & Co., Inc., NEXT Financial Group, Inc., Western International Securities, Inc., and SCF Securities, Inc. Atria’s subsidiaries together support nearly 2,500 financial professionals and over 200 financial institutions with over $100 billion of assets under administration. For more information, please visit www.atriawealth.com.

Atria Wealth Solutions and its affiliated entities are equal opportunity employers that are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Atria Wealth Solutions and its affiliated entities make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

It’s time for the next step in your career. Apply now.

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
Sono Bello® is a data centric industry leader in cosmetic surgery on a mission to change lives through transformative experiences, exemplified by our slogan "Changing Lives One Transformation at a Time." With a legacy of just over a decade, Sono Bello® has expanded its footprint to encompass 80+ locations across the United States. Our remarkable journey is attributed to a dedicated team of board-certified surgeons, alongside our passionate Sono Bello® employees.




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for data, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights. The Data Analyst will work closely with our operations and field leaders to gather, analyze, and interpret data to drive informed decision-making within the organization.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Perform statistical and exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies and communicate findings to business leaders
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using tableau to monitor key metrics and provide clear and actionable insights.
Work with leadership to develop metrics for evaluating business and employee performance
Create compelling presentations using Excel and PowerPoint to communicate findings and recommendations to non-technical team members.
Maintain documentation of data sources, methodologies, and analysis procedures.
Additional duties as assigned




EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or master's degree and relevant coursework
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus.
Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of the job.




OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Proven expertise in SQL and familiarity with Python for data manipulation and analysis.
Strong command of data visualization tools, particularly Tableau, to present insights effectively.
Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint for analysis and presentation purposes.
Demonstrated ability to drive projects independently while collaborating effectively within a team.
Visionary thinking and a strong desire to continuously learn and innovate.




WORK ENVIRONMENT:

We have a hybrid workplace; the Data Analyst will be expected to be in person at our Kirkland WA office at least 3 days a week.




COMPENSATION:

At Sono Bello, we believe that our team members are the keys to our success. The compensation range for this role is $73,000 - $92,000 depending on experience.




BENEFITS:

Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
Health, dental, and vision insurance.
401(k) retirement plan.
Professional development opportunities.
Positive and collaborative work environment.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Who We Are:

With office locations in Pittsburgh and Chicago, Gatesman is a privately held, fully integrated marketing communications agency with expertise in advertising, digital, analytics, public relations, social media, and performance media. We don’t shy away from the unknown and thrive on the speed of business. We solve business challenges by using data, and a human filter to fuel our marketing solutions- whether it’s building brand awareness, improving reputation, launching new products, or publishing brand narratives. We maintain our client relationships with an industry leading tenure of 7+ years on average.

Our agency is frequently named as being one of the Best Places to Work as voted by our own employees, and continuously earn a 90%+ satisfaction rate in blind annual surveys among our clients and employees. With 60+ associates and thriving, Gatesman serves clients nationwide in Healthcare, Higher Ed, Energy, Financial, Retail and B2B.

Jr. Data Analyst

Gatesman is seeking a Jr. Data Analyst who is excited to join our growing analytics team. The Jr. Data Analyst will support the analytics team in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help drive data-informed decision-making. This individual should have a background using numbers and digging into data, heightened attention to detail, and a curiosity for finding business insights in data. Overall, this is someone who will be interested in helping our clients succeed by getting the most out of their data.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with the agency teams to support data analysis, tracking set up, reporting and measurement for all agency-led initiatives.
Work cross-functionally to assist in tracking set-up prior to launch
Push data into database environments through either manual insertion, creating scheduled emails or working with our partner to set up necessary feeds
Pull data from reporting interfaces including various advertising platforms, google analytics and dashboards
Collect and analyze datasets to generate actionable insights
QA dashboards to ensure reliability and usability for the end user; Address dashboard and data issues as they arise
Provide regular reporting that has accurate data, meaningful metrics and key observations
Begin to create compelling dashboards that are easy for stakeholders to interpret and quickly gauge success of initiatives
Deep dive into interesting trends identified in dashboards to help round out more meaningful insights
Proven ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate with various departments


The successful candidate will demonstrate the following characteristics:


Thoughtful and curious with a data-driven approach to solving business problems
Strong analytical skills with experience in data usage and confidence with numbers and logic
High attention to details; ability to follow key data processes to achieve desired end result
Strong written and verbal communications skills with the ability to take complex data and articulate them in easily understood concepts
Energized by learning new things and continuous improvement
Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams to achieve shared objectives
Commitment to delivering measurable results and a proven ability to manage projects to successful completion


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Economics, Statistics or related discipline
Proficiency using Excel (including pivot tables and VLOOKUP), reporting interfaces and data visualization software
Experience with Tableau and/or other dashboarding tools


Preferred Qualifications:


One year experience in business and/or marketing analytics preferred
Familiarity and understanding of digital advertising and marketing preferred
Experience using marketing data via Google Ads, Meta Ads, LinkedIn Ads preferred
Some experience writing code in SQL or python preferred


Gatesman Benefits:


Hybrid Work Schedule
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance available on the first day of employment
FSA/HSA’s
401k with an employer match
Unlimited PTO
Flex Friday’s
13 Holiday’s including time off between Christmas and New Years
Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
Strong culture and supportive working environment

title: Jr. Data Analyst

description:
Summary:


This role is supporting an ongoing project. We are key stakeholders in a large company project and will need analyst support.
We are replacing a legacy system with a totally new format. We will need help setting priorities through data as well as validating improvements (gap analysis)
Looking for analyst that can help analyze data and trends.
Would like experience with process mapping.
Understanding of Six Sigma principles but does not need to be green belt.
Must have experience with Excel, Microsoft Project, Power BI


Key Responsibilities:


Compile and analyze data to help formulate business direction and to prioritize direction and focus
Gather data from multiple sources
Correlate and present data
Analyze data and trends
Perform gap analysis and process mapping of procedures


Top Skills required:


STRONG SQL FOUNDATION
Power BI - Should have at least 2 years experience. Preferably, experience from professional environment building/designing robust Power BI dashboards.
The Manager would like to see samples of Power BI work - please upload on the candidate's profile.
Advanced Excel User
Must demonstrate strong collaboration and communication skills
STRONG Analytical Skills


Compensation:

The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on several factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, competencies, competencies, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements).

Benefits and Ancillaries:

Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee.

title: Data Analyst Level 1

description:
Aviva Systems Biology is a fast-paced, mid-stage life sciences research tools company located in San Diego, CA.  We commercialize life science tools and reagents for research, drug discovery, and diagnostics. 

 

Location: Must be available to work on-site in San Diego, CA

 

How will you make an impact?




The data analyst will manage Aviva’s catalog of over 500,000 life science tools and reagents. Qualified candidates will have 1+ years of experience working with large databases. This role will ultimately manage upkeep and integrity of all SaaS and internal databases including Website, ERP, and CRM.




This is a highly collaborative role which will interface with cross-functional departments to support business reporting needs. Clear communication skills and careful execution with attention to details are a must. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment as part of a highly focused team.




Job Responsibilities:




Partner with operations, product management, technical support and external partners to maintain integrity of Aviva’s product catalog and manage updates for over 500k items.
Ensure integrity of data flowing between web and ERP, optimize process and workflows.
Understand Aviva’s products to manage product data uploads, including scientific and image data.
Manage customer and contact data updates to CRM.
Manage pipeline for vendor updates, pricing updates, and new product launches.
Develop and document workflow to synchronize product data across multiple discrete databases.
Execute data queries across multiple data sources to support business reporting needs.
Other duties as assigned.

 

Education Requirements:




B.A./B.S. in Computer Sciences, or other technical discipline.




Experience Desired:




1+ years product data management experience.
Demonstrated experience handling large data sets from various sources.
Experience in the design and management of relational databases: MySQL, Access DB.
Experience with Magento 2 and NetSuite ERP a plus.
Experience with Salesforce, Freshsales, or other CRM a plus.

 

Skills and Abilities

Excellent planning, organizational, problem solving, and interpersonal skills.
Clear communicator who can articulate complex data concepts and strategies to stakeholders of all levels and experience.
Strong quantitative skills with hands on experience analyzing large amounts of data.
Ability to meet multiple projects, priorities, and deadlines, with a high degree of accuracy and efficiency.

 

WORKING CONDITIONS

Some heavy lifting, kneeling, squatting, etc. may be required.

 

 

You must be authorized to work in the United States without restriction or sponsorship.

 

Interested candidates should forward questions and a resume to hr@avivasysbio.com.

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
Our client a leading asset management firm, located in New York City is looking to hire a SQL Data Analyst. As a Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy, establish robust data governance practices, and ensure efficient reporting solutions within our organization. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the data landscape, enabling data-driven decision-making, and optimizing data assets to drive business success. You will also work closely with the business to understand their data requirements and deliver solutions to support their needs. This is a Full Time Position. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor currently. Qualified candidates should send their resumes (Word Format) along with salary expectations to careers@velocitysgi.com .

MUST HAVE AZURE SSIS (AZURE SYNAPSE)

Responsibilities


Design and implement a forward-looking data strategy that aligns with the organization's business objectives, incorporating industry best practices and emerging data technologies.
Define and maintain a scalable, efficient, and flexible data architecture that accommodates diverse data sources and formats, while enabling seamless data integration and access. Work closely with business stakeholders to align architecture with their requirements.
Design and develop robust ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to efficiently move, cleanse, and transform data from various sources into a central data repository, meeting business needs.
Implement and manage master data management solutions to ensure data consistency, accuracy, and reliability across the organization, in collaboration with various departments.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to define reporting requirements and deliver business intelligence and reporting solutions that provide actionable insights. Work closely with various departments to understand their reporting needs.
Establish data quality standards, conduct data profiling, and implement data quality improvement processes to maintain data integrity, with consideration for business-specific data quality requirements.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of data assets, data flows, and data definitions, making it accessible to relevant business teams.
Continuously assess emerging data technologies and tools to keep the organization up-to-date and competitive.
Design and implement databases to reflect new and existing business requirements.
Evaluate current data designs and databases to determine needed, upgrades and improvements.
Design and automate various internal and external reports using SSRS, InDesign and Power BI.
Communicate with many different company stakeholders to assess needs and goals.
Interpret functional and business requirements, design and implement solutions and architecture suited to our current business model and enhance them.


QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
2+ years working experience in IT at Financial Institutions.
3+ years full stack development of enterprise applications and database solutions.
Hands on experience with SQL Server, Azure, SSRS, Power BI.
Experience in data architecture, data strategy, data governance, and reporting.
In-depth knowledge of database management systems, data modeling, ETL processes, and reporting tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Knowledge of industry best practices and data management trends
Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of business domain is recommended.
Proficiency in Azure data services and technologies.
Strong understanding of data architecture, data modeling, and data governance principles.
Knowledge of ETL processes and tools, particularly within the Azure ecosystem.
Experience with master data management (MDM) and data quality management.
Expertise in data reporting and analytics tools, especially those integrated with Azure.
In-depth knowledge of data security and compliance, including Azure security practices.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
Expertise in T-SQL and SQL Server Data Management Services (SSMS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)Solid knowledge of T-SQL (SQL Server) which includes stored procedures, UDF's and query optimization.
Solid knowledge of ETL, SSRS and Power BI.
Experience in T-SQL, SSRS, Power BI and SQL Server database management system.
Good understanding of Azure environment and DevOps.
InDesign Automation a plus.


Salary 100-120k

description:
Location: In Office 4 days/week in LA office

Who We Are:

Thrive Causemetics is Bigger Than Beauty™: We are an independent, female-owned beauty brand that creates high-performance vegan cosmetics and supports a community of giving. All of Thrive Causemetics' products are free of parabens and sulfates, in addition to being 100 percent cruelty-free. Through its Bigger Than Beauty™ program, every product you purchase results in a donation to help a woman thrive. Thrive Causemetics is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and cross-functional workplace where everyone’s voice matters. We are committed to being pioneers in creating a culture of wellness. Together, we prioritize a strong work ethic while maintaining a positive, exciting environment where people are passionate about what they do .

Who We Are Looking For:

The Data Analyst role at Thrive Causemetics is a hybrid role combining the skill sets of a data analyst, business intelligence analyst. You will work cross functionally with multiple departments, with a focus on growth marketing efforts (CRM, Search, Digital Marketing). This includes helping out with dashboard creation, data pipelines, inventory forecasting and other ad hoc data requests as needed.

What You Will Be Doing:


Apply creative problem-solving skills across various business domains, including marketing & demand planning, to address unique challenges
Leverage customer data analysis to refine and enhance marketing strategies for both e-commerce and brand marketing
Develop dashboards that blend data visualizations and tabular information, delivering real-time insights accessible to all departments
Daily / weekly / monthly KPI reporting for Marketing, Operations and Ecom
QA: Conduct quality assurance to ensure the accuracy of final reports and dashboards
Generate insights from marketing ad performance to improve our paid ad efficiency
Evaluate and improve current business processes related to data management by identifying opportunities for automation and streamlining
Translate data into easy-to-digest insights for non-analytical stakeholders
Fulfill ad hoc data requests and perform data queries as required


What Will Make You Stand Out:


Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or related field
1+ year of SQL experience
1+ year of experience with Python for data analytics (pandas, sklearn, matplotlib, seaborn, plot.ly )
1+ year of experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau, Looker)


Thrive Causemetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The base pay range for this role is $70,000 -$100,000, with the following factors determining the base pay at offer: skills, qualifications, experience. This range provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. Additionally, this role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus based on company and individual performance. Thrive Causemetics provides a competitive benefits package, including but not limited to: comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, a 401(k) plan with employer matching, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks, life insurance, disability insurance, and employee assistance programs.

The Data team (DAA1.1) is the driver of Munich Re’s data strategy. We strategically invest in the creation of data products by structuring internal data and sourcing external data from data providers where appropriate. At the exciting forefront of the digital transformation and the rapidly growing importance of data, it is our mission to enable the organization to generate additional bottom-line results by leveraging the power of data.

The Data Assets Team is based out of Munich and the US and works with internal and external partners across the globe. The team closely liaises and jointly drives projects with all business units and central units like Corporate Underwriting and Corporate Claims. In order to grow the team, we are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial and/or product mindset, being curious, committed, and excited about shaping the future of Munich Re in the role of a Data Analyst.

YOUR JOB


Support the execution of Munich Re´s data strategy
Work closely together with underwriting, claims and actuarial teams to understand their business needs and data requirements
Work in cross functional data product teams as a data analyst to evaluate the quality and fit of different internal and external data sets
Use self service data management tools to link and transform data from different sources and build visualizations and dashboards
Leverage the power of AI and LLMs to extract information from documents, excel sheets and other semi-structured sources
Actively market your data product to relevant Munich Re internal stakeholders in North America and globally
Keep track of usage, adoption and total cost of ownership for your data product

Good understanding of the US (re-)insurance market with relevant experience for 2+ years

Experience in working in an agile setup for 2+ years

Pull and compile data from multiple, non-standardized sources
Recognize data issues and work with providers of data to resolve problems
Generate standard and ad hoc reports on a regular basis
Develop and support new analytical tools and reports
Provide consulting, training, and technical support as need for data intensive projects
Deliver projects accurately and on time
Prepare spreadsheets, graphs, charts, diagrams, and other illustrative tools used in presentations
Communicate results to internal and external clients in a consultative manor
Provide exceptional customer service and adhere to the Lockton philosophies
Examine and interpret a wide variety of data/information to make recommendations or decisions
Normalizing loss run data from Excel into a SQL database – ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the data in SQL.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics or related field; or equivalent education and/or experience.
1-2 years of analytical experience strongly preferred
Superior attention to detail
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel spreadsheet applications (array formulas, if-then statements, v-lookup, and pivot tables)
Strong mathematical and statistical aptitude (rates, percentages, statistical analysis)
Familiarity with BI Reporting Tools and Data Warehouse analysis preferred (Power BI, SQL, Python)
Demonstrated analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills, including research and investigation, to develop results oriented solutions
Ability to quickly grasp new concepts and applications
Ability to examine and interpret a wide variety of data/information to make recommendations or decisions
Demonstrated effectiveness in working with multi-functional teams in a technical production environment
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and written
Ability to multitask without sacrificing the quality and accuracy of project deliverables
Aptitude to develop unique, creative, and efficient work products. Challenges current procedures to implement alternative methods to streamline and improve work products.
Assumes ownership for individual projects. Self-motivated to actively seek solutions to problems without supervision.
Prioritize heavy workloads to meet time sensitive deadlines while handling several projects
Works effectively individually and cooperatively in a team-oriented group setting. Promotes open participation.

Atria Wealth Solutions, Inc. (Atria) is a wealth management solution holding company focused on delivering a clear path to the future of financial advice for financial professionals, financial institutions, and their clients. Headquartered in New York City, Atria’s broker-dealer and investment adviser subsidiaries empower financial institutions and independent financial professionals with a sophisticated set of tools, services, and capabilities that deepen client relationships and maximize efficiencies in their practices. We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our amazing platform team. This position is responsible for performing data delivery and quality analysis and support for requirements and testing on efforts to grow and optimize our advisor workstation. The Junior Data Analyst responsibilities will include migrating third party CRM data to advisor’s workstation CRM and assisting Senior Data analysts with data comparison, manipulation, and analysis. Location: This position may be done HYBRID out of one the following home office locations or fully remote: Houston, TX: 11740 Katy Freeway, Energy Tower III Ste 600, 77079 San Diego, CA: 10150 Meanley Drive, San Diego 92131 Syracuse, NY: 100 Madison Street, Syracuse 13202 Fully Remote - USA Salary:

The anticipated annual base salary range for this position is $55,000 to $62,000. Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. What you will do: Data Delivery Analysis Provide research and support for all in-bound & out-bound files. Identify, communicate, and resolve data quality and delivery issues with data providers. Provide testing support for all in-bound and out-bound files. Monitor daily data delivery and ETL jobs. Data Quality Analysis Monitor data quality alerts and conduct data analysis on the alert outputs Extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns Ad-hoc SQL queries to support data analysis Perform data reconciliations and support resolution of discrepancies QA and UAT test of system changes Migrating Third Party CRM Data to Advisor Workstation CRM (Unio) Formulate a CRM data migration plan with Advisors. Conduct data extraction from 3rd Party CRM. Perform data clean up. Work with developers to upload data to staging and production site. Conduct testing in staging environment. Provide updates and host meetings with advisors during data transition. Manage, develop, and maintain reports for use by various departments. Assist Senior Data Analysts with: Data Comparison Data Import / Export Data Clean up Data Entry Must haves: Bachelor's Degree in or equivalent work experience 2+ years of experience working data in business environment Proficiency in SQL, MS Office products, specifically Excel Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Strong attention to details Experience with business intelligence tools Strong oral communication skills Strong written communication skills Strong data entry/keyboard typing skills Self-motivated, demonstrate high level of initiative Why work at Atria? In addition to a competitive salary, we provide a full benefits package that includes: Medical & Prescription Drug Insurance Health Advocacy Telehealth Dental Insurance Vision Insurance Health Savings Account Flexible Spending Accounts Short-Term Disability Insurance Long-Term Disability Insurance Life Insurance Paid time off, Paid Holiday, Paid Birthday Critical Illness, Accident & Hospital Indemnity Coverage Identity Theft Employee Assistance Program Pet Insurance Legal Plans Virtual Therapy Virtual Mental WellCare Long-Term Care Retirement 401(k) Savings Plan with matching At Atria, we consider Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging to be essential to our success, and we are working to integrate it into the fabric of our organization. title: Data Analyst

description:
Job Description

The Analyst, Data Science will have the unique opportunity to blend high level strategic thinking with intensive data analytics to drive insights and recommendations for Ventas’ Senior Housing portfolio (800+ properties, $1B+ in Net Operating Income). The successful candidate will work cross-functionally with portfolio management, investments, and operating partners to identify pockets of opportunity within and outside of Ventas’ current portfolio. If you are analytical, detail-oriented, curious, and a fast learner, we look forward to meeting you.

Responsibilities


Build and manage data pipelines for the ingestion and analysis of structured and unstructured data from operating partners and other third parties
Develop controls and workflows to ensure quality and accuracy of data
Design, develop, and enhance proprietary models to improve competitive and operational intelligence
Utilize our proprietary data sets and predictive analytics to improve our ability to forecast KPIs such as rate, occupancy, mix, etc.
Engage with internal and external stakeholders to provide strategic insights on growth and investment opportunities (acquisitions, dispositions, redevelopment, etc.)
Act as a resource for colleagues with less experience; may lead small teams or small projects


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Engineering, Statistics or similar field
2+ years’ experience in data science, data engineering, or technology consulting
Ability to learn quickly and solve complex problems within a dynamic environment
Proficiency in Power BI required
Proficiency in Python and data modeling (DAX, Airflow/Dagster) a plus
Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills; must be capable of explaining complex information to others in a straightforward manner
Ability to manage deadlines, multiple tasks and relationships in a fast-paced, team-oriented and lean environment
Knowledge and interest in real estate and health care are a plus


The compensation available for the role considers a variety of factors including, but not limited to, work location, individual skill set, previous/applicable experience, and other business needs. The estimated salary range for individuals who work in New York City is $75k to $100K. The above salary range represents Ventas’ good faith and reasonable estimate of the possible base salary range at the time of posting and is one part of the total rewards Ventas provides to employees.

Ventas, Inc. offers a competitive compensation and benefits package to the successful candidate.

Ventas, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Ventas, Inc. does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing agencies, search firms or any third parties.

description:

ROSEN offers sophisticated and highly innovative products and services to the oil and gas and other engineering industries. ROSEN is an extended team of people with a passion for technology and innovation. We are always looking for young professionals as well as experienced employees.

Our ongoing organic growth results in career opportunities and gives our employees chances for further development and added experience.

For more information about ROSEN go to www.rosen-group.com .

ROSEN USA, based in Gahanna, OH seeks to employ an In-Line Inspection – Data Analyst.

Responsibilities:


Through the performance of daily tasks, and in cooperation with other department process functions, execute all aspects of the L1 and L2 Data Analysis process per ROSEN policies and procedures.
Receive pipeline In-line inspection data from ROSEN sub-processes, check for quality and quantity using ROSEN proprietary software, procedures, and specifications.
Analyze and interpret In-Line Inspection signal data to identify both references and anomalies.
Perform In-Line Inspection data correlation and compare individual results of different inspections.
Configure, prepare, and manipulate software for customer.
Report data analysis results in a variety of report deliverables in accordance with project reporting requirements.
Provide project status updates to Evaluation lead.


Requirements

Qualification or Skills:


A four - year degree or equivalent work experience in a related area is preferred. A minimum two - year degree in a technical discipline is required.
Satisfactory completion of the required training and experience as required by ANSI/ASNT ILI-PQ-2017 per applicable technology.
Intermediate Microsoft Office skills, particularly Microsoft Word and Excel.
Excellent interpersonal skills – ability to work well within a team environment.
Excellent troubleshooting skills.
Strong communication skills – both written and verbal.
Strong analytical and interpretive skills.
Detail oriented/organizational skills required.
Ability to grasp new concepts quickly and easily.
Excellent Time Management skills.
Ability to manage multiple project deadlines.

Successfully complete a drug screen test, background check and physical performance evaluation including a vision exam as applicable to the position

title: Data Analyst

description:
Amalgamated Bank is seeking a Data Analyst who will work under the guidance of and assists the Director of Finance Data & Analytics in analyzing data and generating insights to support strategic decision-making. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in finance, data analysis, technology, and excellent problem solving skills with the ability to think creatively.

By joining our team, you’ll be joining a Bank that believes that that maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected is essential for us to grow as a company. We are dedicated to building a more equitable world in our everyday practices by embracing the values of our employees and customers.

Essential Job Functions


Oversee the maintenance of the data tables, imports/exports, and scheduled jobs in Axiom
Gather, process, and analyze large datasets, ensuring data accuracy and integrity
Conduct detailed data analysis and generate actionable insights to support strategic decision-making
Analyze historical financial data to identify trends and patterns, and develop financial models and forecasts to predict future financial performance and support budgeting processes.
Develop and maintain financial reports, dashboards, and KPIs to monitor financial performance
Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiencies within the finance department; implement new analytics tools and techniques
Collaborate within the finance department to build reports that aid in process automation
Work closely with the finance and reporting team to understand business needs and provide analytical support
Communicate complex data insights and recommendations clearly and concisely
Develop and maintain comprehensive process documentation for all data analysis procedures
Conduct ad hoc analyses to support strategic initiatives


Knowledge, Skills And Experience Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Data Science, or other related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the banking industry
Proficiency in data analysis tools/software (e.g., Excel, SQL)
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with Axiom or other database reporting tools preferred
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as a part of a team in a fast-paced environment


Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting base salary for this role is between $120,000.00 – $140,000.00. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferrable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Amalgamated Bank is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, Minorities / Females / Individuals with Disability / Veterans . AmeriCorps, Peace Corps and other national service alumni are encouraged to apply. View our Pay Transparency Statement . Submission of a resume or any information regarding your qualifications does not constitute a promise or offer of employment. At Amalgamated Bank, we consider an applicant to be someone who has interviewed at least once, in person, with the hiring manager. Amalgamated Bank does not sponsor applicants for work visas.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Company Description

Tomorrow RNG is a renewable natural gas (RNG) producer focused on reducing emissions and creating a greener future. With cutting-edge facilities and a dedicated team of over 90 professionals, we seamlessly integrate the RNG value chain to ensure excellence for our landfill partners and the communities we serve. Guided by values of integrity and sustainability, Tomorrow RNG is backed by Enbridge's 175+ year pedigree in the natural gas industry, delivering top-tier assets that exceed customer and partner expectations.

Position Summary

The Data Analyst's responsibilities include analyzing complex datasets, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights to contribute to strategic decision-making and operational excellence.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities


Identifying and communicating with key stakeholders.
Gathering, reviewing, and analyzing business and industry data, including KPIs, reports and other key metrics using data analytics tools.
Maintaining documentation regarding various projects, processes, and operations.
Understanding cost rates, financials, budgets, and forecasting for business planning.
Analyzing financial reports and suggesting strategies for improving business performance.
Developing predictive models and algorithms to forecast business outcomes and drive continuous improvement.
Assessing options for process improvement, including business process modeling.
Designing and implementing data analytics processes, including data collection, cleansing, analysis, and visualization.
Liaising between various business departments and groups.
Collaborating with project managers and cross-functional teams.
Working alongside engineers and other cross-functional team members to analyze reports.
Creating reports, dashboards, and visualizations to help others understand business performance.
Conducting in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.
Creating and presenting comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Identifying specific business opportunities and ways to capitalize on them.
Staying updated with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and contributing to the development of data-driven strategies.


Qualifications & Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Engineering, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience in finance, business development, or relevant field within the oil and gas industry.
Proficient in data analytics tools, including SQL, Python, R, Tableau, or Power BI.
Demonstrated ability to run complex analysis, such as financial modeling and valuation analysis.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data concepts into actionable insights.
Experience in testing and mapping various business processes and protocols.

title: Data Analyst

description:
About You

Are you interested in a career that protects the environment and the air we breathe? Are you looking to be a part of a team that is willing to invest in you from day one? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you with our fast-growing ambient air monitoring team.

Who are we? We are Montrose, a global environmental services provider offering environmental planning and permitting, measurement and analytical services, and environmental resiliency and sustainability solutions. Our qualified engineers, scientists, technicians, associates, and policy experts are proud of our collective expertise and the collaborative nature of our approach to helping clients. We strive to optimize environmental resiliency in a way that effectively complements our clients’ decision-making and operations and efficiently fulfills their project requirements.

We have over 90 offices across the United States, Canada, Europe and Australia and approximately 3,500 employees – all ready to provide solutions for environmental needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Compensation: $23 - $27 per hour

What We Can Offer You

As a key member of our Montrose team, you can expect:


Mentorship and professional development resources to advance your career
Direct exposure to our industry’s leading experts who are solving the world’s toughest environmental challenges
An entrepreneurial environment where you can learn, thrive and collaborate with talented colleagues
Opportunities to engage and contribute in our Diversity, Fairness and Inclusion and Women Empowering Leadership employee resource groups
Competitive compensation package: annual salary ranging from $23 to $27/hour, commensurate with accomplishments, performance, credentials and geography
Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage
401k with a competitive 4% employer match
Progressive vacation policies, company holidays and paid parental leave benefits to ensure work/life balance
A financial assistance program that supports peers in need, known as the Montrose Foundation
Access to a student loan planning tool to optimize your student loan payoff plans and compare student loan rates with lenders.



A DAY IN THE LIFE

Montrose Air Quality Services, LLC. is affiliated with Montrose Environmental Group, a high-growth Environmental Services company offering a variety of Measurement and Analytical services to a diverse range of clients in industry and government throughout the United States and abroad. Our qualified engineers, scientists, technicians, associates and policy experts are proud of our ability to objectively help industry, the public and regulators work constructively together on environmental opportunities.

Our ambient air monitoring group is seeking a Data Analyst / Technical Writer to review data and generate reports as well as other tasks to meet the expectations of our clients by efficiently and profitably generating defensible data on time. Strong organizational skills are a must for this position. The following list of duties are responsibilities of the Data Analyst / Technical Writer:


Daily QC-review of raw field data produced by remotely-located, continuous (automated) field air monitoring equipment
Note, investigate, and resolve anomalies in data
Promptly produce Non-Conformance/Corrective Action (NC/CA) Reports to describe details of any problems identified in data QC-review
Track and review NC/CA Reports as they are updated throughout subsequent problem investigation and resolution activities.
QA-review field documentation of monitoring system QC and QA performance and systems audit results using spreadsheets and forms.
Receive, archive and QA-review laboratory analytical data reports of samples and associated field documentation for sample collection activities.
Perform accurate data entry of information from hand written field sheets.
Email/communicate questions, comments, changes and work completed with Project Manager and follow up on all pending questions.
Process raw monitoring data to identify, document and exclude any invalid data using Excel Macro software, validated field QC check and test results, QA audit results, competed NC/CA Reports and established data validation criteria in accordance with project-specific Monitoring Plan, QAPP and SOPs.
Supervise and ensure timely independent QA review of the processed data by designated personnel for final data validation.
Write and assemble data reports in accordance with the project-specific Monitoring Plan
Perform technical and editorial review of draft and final reports for details, grammar and spelling, calculations, results, and conclusions.
Communicate regularly with stakeholders (field staff, labs, clients, regulators, etc.) to ensure data reports conform to project and regulatory agency requirements and are submitted in a timely manner.
Promptly communicate to the Project Manager unacceptable test results, recurring or systemic problems with monitoring project activities or operations and work with the Project Manager and other project team members to provide solutions.
Archive all paper and electronic QA/QC test documentation, test evaluation results, completed NC/CA Reports, raw data files, data processing files, data reports and related communications with clients and regulatory agencies.
Train junior reporting staff on the duties listed above.
Contribute improvement ideas to the Project Manager and other project team members and assist in the development of templates, content, and standard procedures for data management, processing, validation and reporting activities.
Perform various clerical work where needed (printing, scanning, filing, mailing)
Perform other duties as assigned by manager.
Create and update SOPs for the group
Participate in and lead training for career development, safety and maintaining required certifications



Necessary Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.


Bachelor’s degree or higher in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Environmental Engineering or a related field.
Minimum 2 years of experience with gas chromatography is preferable
Experience with understanding and evaluating chromatograms is needed
Expertise in organic chemistry is a bonus
Advanced ambient testing knowledge preferable
Minimum of 2 years of experience in ambient monitoring preferable
Excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills
Ability to perform example calculations to verify spreadsheet results
Punctual and professional when responding to communication
Able to interface with cross-functional teams and all levels of personnel/management
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Able to work independently, managing multiple responsibilities. This position will often be working on multiple reports at once that are in varying stages of completion
Effective verbal and written communication skills
Ability to think and act strategically and proactively
Strong writing and presentation skills
Resourcefulness, flexibility, and resiliency to operate in a dynamic work environment
Leads solutions through the use of collaboration, technology and/or innovative strategies
Ability and motivation to learn, execute and train on advanced technologies, project or skills
Proficient knowledge with Google and Microsoft office Suite products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Capability to pass background checks and initial and random drug screening



The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 949-988-3500 or careers@montrose-env.com for assistance.

MAKE THE MOVE TO ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER

We are going to be blunt – the way we work may not suit everyone. We are a fast-paced, dynamic and high-growth company. You are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues and its service providers. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, and head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we could be the perfect match made in heaven.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to recruiting and hiring qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities.

description:
Arrivals + Departures is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an environment where everyone feels included, valued, and heard. Diversity and inclusion are an important part of our everyday work, and it is our belief that they enable us to reach our goal of seeing the world differently. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communications and/or people with intersectional identities. Accommodations can be made upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.




About us:




Arrivals + Departures (A+D) is an independent creative and media agency based in Toronto and Halifax. We embody an entrepreneurial spirit and the necessary hustle for today's dynamic landscape. Our name reflects our mission to 'See The World Differently', inspired by the evolving environment around us. We tackle each challenge and opportunity with fresh perspectives, avoiding predictable outcomes. We are dedicated to challenging the status quo and relentlessly pursuing unique insights.




Digital Analyst




As a Data Analyst, you are a sucker for data. In fact, you can’t get enough! The Data Analyst is engaged throughout the lifecycle of a campaign. Through ongoing investigation, you uncover insights into consumer behaviours to better understand how best to reach our target audiences in the strategy development phase. Your analysis of post campaign performance provides insights into what worked and where the opportunities lie moving forward.




Supporting the Senior Analyst, primary responsibilities include data analysis, development of digital reports, troubleshooting and testing tracking and platform pixels and implementation of campaign tracking.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with digital media planners on campaigns to determine conversion points, measurements of success and KPI’s.
Generate and place pixels via GoogleTag Manager for campaigns. Includes trouble-shooting, monitoring and integration of Analytics with Google Ads conversions.
Google Analytics account implementation and customization, including GA4 aggregation of campaign data, including retrieval from various platforms.
Analyze and evaluate campaign and website data to develop performance reports, recommendations and optimizations for current/future campaigns.
Develop dashboards and reporting templates on a client-by-client basis. Reports may be required monthly, quarterly, annually.
Act as an in-house expert on web analytics.
Support digital team through analysis of website analytics to prepare reports which include performance insights and recommendations.
Media mix modeling - majority for paid digital. Preparing reports and visualizations to show impact of media where ROI is difficult to correlate (i.e, social).
Working knowledge of various platforms: Meta business manager, Google Ads, LinkedIn, third party ad serving, Pinterest, Snapchat and Twitter
Additional exploration and implementation of tools, solutions and success strategies as required
Bonus skill set: explore and possibly build an API to migrate GA4 data into Big Query










Qualifications:




2+ years experience in campaign reporting, campaign optimization, implementation and troubleshooting and attribution
Proficient in Google suite and Microsoft products
Google Tag Manager experience
Advanced GA4 experience.
Advanced in Looker Studio and Supermetrics
Comfortable in social platforms (Meta, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, etc.)
Comfortable in a fast-paced agency environment
Able to manage deadlines for multiple projects/tasks
Exceptional attention to detail
Problem solver
Able to self teach and research when necessary
Positive attitude
Is self-motivated but loves working in a team environment
















We love people who are curious, ask questions, like to share knowledge and collaborate. If that sounds like you we’d love to talk! Please send your resume to jobs.yyz@arrivalsdepartures.com.

title: Data Analyst

description:
If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join our Global Service Center (GSC)- HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be.

We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of

Data Analyst







Role purpose:

Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. We’re here to use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.

We’re searching for an Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team, this role focused specifically on one of our key areas of need, Lending and Credit Data. The candidate should be a self-motivated and eager to learn individual comfortable working independently or collaboratively with teams across the bank. We use Alteryx for most things and other tools (Python) when they make sense. Our Data Assets are built on GCP, Hadoop, DB2, Teradata and we continuously migrating data assets to Google Cloud Big Query for Analytics and Machine Learning.

Principal accountabilities:

Analyze Wholesale Lending and Credit data to create reporting and provide management insights for business decisions
Engage with end users and effectively map the data requirements
Understand the data sourcing systems landscape, Analyze cross system linkage
Produce data assets by blending data across different source systems (Google Cloud BQ, Hadoop, APIs)
Analyze and Produce data lineage for analytical platforms and day-to-day business cases
Analyze the data and discuss the quality issues and insights with manager
Develop Alteryx Workflows and Python for data wrangling and preparation
Work collaboratively with various teams across the bank on initiatives to generate financial capital (revenue growth, capital efficiency, cost savings, etc.)




Skills

Alteryx (Mandatory
Python (Mandatory)
SQL (Mandatory)
Entity Relationship Data Model (Mandatory)
GCP BigQuery (Preferred)
Wholesale credit and lending (Preferred)




Experience

2 years of work experience in data analysis or data intense roles
2 years of experience in Alteryx, SQL with relational databases
Ability to troubleshoot and solve data integrity problems independently
Maintain and manage data catalogs and dictionaries




You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC!

At HSBC we offer our colleagues a greater number of days so that they can fully enjoy their wedding, take care of the new member of the family, or grieve the loss of a family member. Our paid leave package is at the forefront in Mexico, now you have one more reason to be HSBC and proudly live a culture of well-being, balance and care

HSBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and, opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. We encourage applications from all suitably qualified persons irrespective of, but not limited to, their gender or genetic information, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, social status, medical care leave requirements, political affiliation, people with disabilities, color, national origin, veteran status, etc., We consider all applications based on merit and suitability to the role.

Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

***Issued by HSBC Electronic Data Processing (México) Private LTD***

title: Data Analyst

description:
Job Description

Data Analyst

Overview:

Chubb's North America data delivery team provides business insights, data management, and business and data analysis to North America. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for conducting a detailed analysis of various data sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights that will support strategic decision-making. Additionally, you will perform quality assurance tasks to ensure data accuracy and integrity across our systems. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, advanced knowledge of querying languages, and a keen eye for detail.

Responsibilities:


Perform complex data analysis by querying databases, consolidating information, and conducting statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and identify opportunities for data-driven improvements.
Develop, implement, and maintain QA processes and tools to ensure accurate and reliable data across all systems.
Conduct thorough data validation and verification to identify discrepancies, resolve issues, and maintain data integrity.
Create and maintain documentation for data analysis procedures, QA processes, and related reports.
Collaborate with the data engineering team to optimize database design, structure, and functionality for efficient data retrieval and analysis.
Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders clearly and concisely.


Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, including experience in conducting complex data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization.
Proficient in querying languages (e.g., SQL, Python) with the ability to retrieve data from databases efficiently.
Experience in QA tasks, data validation, and data integrity management.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to identify and resolve data quality issues.
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex data sets and identify insights and trends.
Strong communication and presentation skills to convey complex analytical findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing concepts.
Familiarity with tools like Qlik, Power BI, or similar data visualization platforms.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Analyze each business context and match with Apple IT infrastructure in terms of databases, data extraction, data processing and enrichment, data retention, reporting infrastructure and IT tools, which would be used to come up with a strategy to implement business needs.
Analyze business needs to formulate a system that meets the requirements of business.
Use Apple IT infrastructure and tools like ETL framework, Snowflake, Tableau, Python and ETL metadata setup to create and transform business requirements into technical specifications which covers scope, required process workflow, testing and scope for automation from development to implementation.
Analyze the impact on existing reporting layers and applications due to changes in source system data and addition or modification of source system functionality. Output from impact analysis will provide details on changes required in Services data extracti on, data processing, reporting layer and ultimately on business reporting KPIs reported through GBI reporting UI like Royalty Approval UI, Tableau dashboards and direct reporting SQL queries used by business users.
Extract, clean and Analyze data using SQL, Python to identify patterns and trends on sales data for both prescriptive and predictive analysis
Develop and maintain data centric reports and dashboards in Tableau at both Static and Dynamic stages.
Apply advanced statistical methods to interpret data, generate reports and create presentations that convey findings to the stake holders
Develop and deploy automation scripts in SQL/Python to enhance efficiency in reporting work flows
Implement automation solutions to reduce manual effort, improve accuracy and accelerate business processes
Work closely with cross functional teams including Finance, Operations, Apple care, SAP to understand data requirements and flows to Reporting ESL’s
Troubleshoot data discrepancies and work with relevant teams to resolve issues proactively


Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines, have documentation of process on par with the fast-paced environment.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Data Analytics Analyst

What You'll Do:

· Determine the success of marketing, sales and client/member services (call centers, billing, etc.) programs and initiatives by analyzing production and performance data and presenting results and insightful conclusions in a non-technical manner

· Highly leverage Power BI for data visualization, analysis and reporting for interactive and automated solutions to business requests

· Interpret and quantify results by building database queries to synthesize data, applying the appropriate statistical tests, oftentimes across multiple disparate data sources

· Develop recommendations/solutions and present results to internal customers

· Collaborate with internal marketing, sales & distribution, and business operations teams

· Manage a variety of projects and tasks simultaneously and deliver solutions on time and within requirements

What It Takes to Join Our Team:

· College degree (Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Economics, Finance, or Business preferred) or equivalent plus one-year relevant experience preferred. Data research and analysis experience preferred.

· Proficient in Microsoft Excel.

· Experience with Power BI or equivalent preferred.

· Experience with SQL, R or Python preferred.

· Experience with relational databases preferred.

· Ability to merge and analyze data from various sources and of differing formats.

· Must have strong analytical and logical skills and be able to learn/apply new software and capture, analyze and synthesize data and report results.

· Self-starter who will take initiative and find innovative solutions to achieve business objectives.

· Must have problem solving and organizational skills with high attention to detail.

· Ability to work from our office in West Des Moines, Iowa.

What We Offer You: When you're on our team, you get more than a great paycheck. You'll hear about career development and educational opportunities. We offer an enhanced 401K with a match, low-cost health, dental, and vision benefits, and life and disability insurance options. We also offer paid time off, including holidays and volunteer time, and teams who know how to have fun. Add to that an onsite wellness facility with fitness classes and programs, a daycare center, a cafeteria, and for many positions, even consideration for a hybrid work arrangement. Farm Bureau....where the grass really IS greener!

If you're interested in joining a company that appreciates employees, provides growth and professional development opportunities, and offers great benefits, we invite you to apply today!

Work Authorization/Sponsorship: At this time, we are not considering candidates that need any type of immigration sponsorship now or in the future, such as additional or permanent work authorization. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, permanent basis. We are not able to sponsor now or in the future, or take over sponsorship of, an employment visa or work authorization for this role. For example, we are not considering candidates with OPT status.

title: Data Analytics Analyst

description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title And Summary

Analyst, Data Governance

Overview

Mastercard Enterprise Data Governance is looking for an Analyst, Data Governance to join a team leading the development and delivery of data governance strategy to drive best in class data management practices across the organization’s data ecosystem.

As an Analyst, Data Governance you will be a key player in supporting and assisting with cross-functional coordination and collaboration with partners and data ecosystem stewardship to drive operationalizing and measuring adherence to data governance policy and standards. Your contributions will be instrumental in the Mastercard Data Governance vision to unlock and accelerate the value of data for our business and customers.

Role


Support the Data Governance Office in operationalizing data governance strategy & policy across the Mastercard data ecosystem.
Assist with the documentation and maintenance of standards & procedures, work instructions, process, & playbooks.
Support documentation and tracking for remediation planning, measuring, and monitoring activities for data governance strategy, data domains, data risk, and internal audit.
Support documentation and maintenance of identified and assigned business, technical, and services related roles required for stewardship representation.
Support cross-functional coordination & collaboration of global data ecosystem data management initiatives (cloud, data catalog, etc.) as needed.
Assist with guided data management implementation within or across specified domains of data (data lifecycle management, metadata management, data quality, master and reference data management, data integration & interoperability, and AI & analytics enablement)
Assist with the delivery and tracking of education & training to data governance stakeholders and data ecosystem stewardship.
Assist with the documentation and tracking of continuous improvement efforts including but not limited to plan, do, check, act.



All About You


Experience in data governance, data management, or related roles, preferably in a large enterprise environment.
Intermediate level proficiency in the comprehension of industry standard and best practice data governance and data management theories, principles, practices, and methodologies
Exposure to data governance and management technical platforms related to activities around data cataloging, business glossary development, lineage and other relationship properties, stewardship engagement, metadata enrichment (ex. Informatica, Collibra, Alation)
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data issues and develop practical solutions.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with and facilitate activities across cross-functional teams and stakeholders.



Mastercard is an inclusive equal opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. In the US or Canada, if you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process or during the recruitment process, please contact reasonable_accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:


Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.



In line with Mastercard’s total compensation philosophy and assuming that the job will be performed in the US, the successful candidate will be offered a competitive base salary based on location, experience and other qualifications for the role and may be eligible for an annual bonus or commissions depending on the role. Mastercard benefits for full time (and certain part time) employees generally include: insurance (including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, disability, life insurance), flexible spending account and health savings account, paid leaves (including 16 weeks new parent leave, up to 20 paid days bereavement leave), 10 annual paid sick days, 10 or more annual paid vacation days based on level, 5 personal days, 10 annual paid U.S. observed holidays, 401k with a best-in-class company match, deferred compensation for eligible roles, fitness reimbursement or on-site fitness facilities, eligibility for tuition reimbursement, gender-inclusive benefits and many more.
