‎

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

‎

For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices .

‎

‎

Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)

title: Data Analyst II - Walmart Data Ventures

description:
LS Direct is looking for a passionate Data Analyst to join our growing data department. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. As a Data Analyst, you join our data team in supporting the day-to-day execution and analytics of direct marketing campaigns and metrics. You will ensure timely and accurate support of our company’s strategic goals while supporting our external customer base.

• Company location: Suffern, NY.

• Expected hours of work: Generally, work is performed Monday through Friday, though holidays and weekends may be required. This is a hybrid full-time position after successful training; 3 days in office, and 2 days at home.

About LS Direct

LS Direct is a data-driven marketing program. LS provides powerful analysis essential in today’s market. Our rich data allows us to understand the ins and outs of our client’s customer base so we can best engage and win with them, while at the same time reaching new ones. While our advanced technology and analytics stack up against some of the biggest tech conglomerates out there, we are a boutique business that believes long-term relationships are key to success. We have the brightest team of data scientists and analysts and provide hands-on, data-driven support to our clients.

Core Responsibilities

· Translate and distill insights from primary and secondary data sources for clients to help them understand their business needs and strategies for growth.

· Manage multiple projects across clients and industries.

· Develop visualizations that highlight trends and adhere to best practices.

· Contribute to the overall documentation of processes and protocols amongst the data team.

· Re-examine and fine-tune preexisting workflows to optimize for time and quality.

· Work with large data files from external partners and LS Direct’s internal data architecture.

· Continue to refine modeling of customer scoring and predictive analytics.

· Collaborate with other teams and departments across multiple projects and functions.

· Create customer lists from distinct business needs/rules of external partners and LS Direct’s proprietary algorithm.

We’re Looking for Someone With

· Experience with any combination of the following: Excel, SQL, Python, R, and/or Alteryx.

· Bachelor's degree or 2+ years relevant work experience.

· Ability to understand and interpret transactional and secondary data sources.

· Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with a focus on communication and project management.

· Exceptional organizational skills and detail-oriented team member.

· A growth mindset, committed to continuous improvement and taking on challenges.

· Experience in marketing or data analysis.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Northern Virginia / DC Metro Area

This role does require an active CBP BI.

People Centered. Data Driven

Elder Research Inc. is a Data Science consulting firm specialized in providing analytic solutions to clients in Commercial and Government industries. Providing analytic solutions to hundreds of companies across numerous industries, our team enjoys a great variety in the type of work they do and exposure to a wide range of techniques and tools.

We are trusted advisors to our clients, building lasting relationships and partnering as preferred analytics providers. We use a variety of programming languages and tools to create analytic solutions, often fitting within our clients’ environment and needs.

Join our team and find great opportunities to hone your analytic skills, work on complex problems with amazing teammates, and gain valuable analytics consulting experience.

Opportunity

Role

We are looking for talented and motivated employees that will play important roles on multi-discipline teams that will provide strategic level assistance, consultation, recommendations, and support to our customer in the areas of:


Workforce and succession planning where we will play a role developing strategic workforce plans and identifying and addressing gaps between the workforce of today and the workforce of tomorrow.
Data-driven strategy formulation and analytics support where we will assist with strategy formulation concerning resource planning, programming, budgeting, financial management, and mission execution activities.
Business transformation where we will perform analyses and provide recommendations to improve existing processes, capabilities, and mission execution and support functions.


Position Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will perform one or more of the following activities:


Develop or apply mathematical or statistical theory and methods to collect, organize, interpret, and summarize numerical data to provide usable information.
Responsible for the development of analytical solutions and databases. Develops specifications for the most efficient database solutions. Good working knowledge and hands-on experience with key software platform architectures, web servers, application servers, and relational databases. May evaluate new data sources for adherence to the organization's quality standards and ease of integration. Provide consultation on complex projects.
Assist in exploring, categorizing, and reviewing information. Inspect, clean, transform and model data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions and supporting CBP decision-making; ability to mine, review and validate data in order to develop models and data visualization that focus on predictive purposes and developing pertinent business information for CBP decision-makers. In addition, have the ability to create and manage dashboards. Be able to review database architecture and data control polices and offer recommendations for improvement and be able to support the existing development of an activity-based costing (ABC) model or development of new ABC models as required.


This role does require an active CBP BI.

About Elder Research, Inc

Elder Research is a fast growing consulting firm specializing in predictive analytics. Being in the data mining business over 20 years, we pride ourselves in our ability to find creative, cutting edge solutions to real-world problems. We work hard to provide the best value to our clients and allow each person to contribute their ideas and put their skills to use immediately.

Our team members are passionate, curious, life-long learners. We value humility, servant-leadership, teamwork, and integrity. We seek to serve our clients and our teammates to the best of our abilities. In keeping with our entrepreneurial spirit, we want candidates who are self-motivated with an innate curiosity and strong team work.

Elder Research believes in continuous learning; each week the entire company attends a “Tech Talk” followed by an office lunch. Elder Research provides a supportive work environment with established parental, bereavement, and PTO policies. By prioritizing a healthy work-life balance - with reasonable hours, solid pay, low travel, and extremely flexible time off - Elder Research enables and encourages its employees to serve others.

Elder Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Elder Research is a Government contractor and our positions require US Citizenship.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Position Summary

DCC Propane is seeking a highly motivated and analytical Junior Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in data analysis and visualization using QlikView or QlikSense. As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the analysis and reporting needs of various departments within the organization with a primary focus on the Sales, Marketing and Operations departments. This is an excellent opportunity for a self-driven individual who is passionate about leveraging data to drive insights and support decision-making processes.

Core Duties/Key Responsibilities

Primary Focus: Assist with the scope and design of QlikSense applications. Particular focus will be in the following areas:


Customer Profitability Analysis, Customer Churn Analysis, Customer Analytics and Trends. Additional focus will be on Lost Revenue Analysis across various business segments, including our rental, fuels, service, and labor businesses.
Assist with the presentation of dashboards and business discovery information to management and other key business users.


Collaborative Support: Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and provide support in data analysis and visualization. Assist in ad-hoc data requests and contribute to ongoing projects.

Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to help identify trends, patterns, and insights. Use QlikSense for visualizations and reports that effectively communicate findings to stakeholders.

Reporting and Dashboard Creation: Assist with the design of dashboards, reports, and interactive visualizations using QlikSense. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and work with our Qlik developers to translate them into actionable visualizations.

Data Integration: Ensure data accuracy and consistency by performing data validation and quality checks.

Data Maintenance: Assist in data cleaning, transformation, and preparation activities to ensure data integrity and reliability. Collaborate with data owners and IT administrators to maintain data pipelines and optimize data storage and retrieval processes.

Documentation: Document data analysis procedures, methodologies, and visualization designs. Maintain clear and organized documentation for future reference and knowledge sharing.

Quality Assurance: Conduct regular quality assurance checks on data, reports, and visualizations to ensure accuracy, consistency, and adherence to established standards. Troubleshoot and resolve issues in a timely manner.

Training: Training, Maintenance and Support of all QlikSense applications.

Position Qualifications

Education: bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline.

Experience: 1-2 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably using QlikView or QlikSense. Familiarity with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes is a plus. Understanding of Qlik Datawarehouse and Transformation processes.

Technical Skills


Proficiency in QlikView or QlikSense for data analysis and visualization.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Knowledge of data modeling concepts and best practices.
Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.
Familiarity with scripting languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus.


Analytical Mindset: Ability to think critically, identify patterns, and draw meaningful insights from complex datasets. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.

Attention to Detail: Meticulous in data handling, ensuring accuracy, and performing quality checks. Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality work with attention to detail.

Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively present data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Active listening skills to understand requirements and provide appropriate solutions.

Team Player: Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Strong interpersonal skills and a positive attitude towards working in a team environment.

Time Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize workloads, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong organizational skills and attention to deadlines.

Physical/Working Requirements

The work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be available to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is:


This position is hybrid and requires you to frequently work from an office environment.
Prolonged sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to position, transport, lift and/or move up to 15 pounds at a time.
Stand, walk, move across large areas.
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl or otherwise reach into confined spaces.
Communicate with and exchange information verbally and in writing.
Move about in an office environment.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.


This job description is not intended to describe in detail the multitude of tasks that may be assigned, but rather to provide the employee with a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of his/her position. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position. As the nature of business demands change so, too, may the essential functions of this position.

DCC Propane is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, military status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst (Entry Level 0- 5 Years Experience)

description:
Company Overview

Newell Brands is a leading $8.5B consumer products company with a portfolio of iconic brands such as Graco®, Coleman®, Oster®, Rubbermaid® and Sharpie®, and 28,000 talented employees around the world. Our high-performance culture, unparalleled curiosity about the world around us, and talented people fuel our success. Our culture is enabled through our core values which guide all we do and how we win as One Newell. They are Integrity, Teamwork, Passion for Winning, Ownership & Leadership.

As an AI Data Analyst, you'll work closely with our development team to embed AI into our insights and innovation process. Using existing LLMs you'll create chatbot personas and systems to connect key knowledge centers in the business. If you're passionate about AI, have a keen eye for detail, and enjoy working collaboratively, this role is perfect for you.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with the Design. Consumer Insights and IT teams to build a robust portfolio of chatbots for insights and innovation.
Identify areas for chatbot improvement based on user feedback and performance metrics.
Adjust tone, language, and behavior to align with user expectations.
Continuously iterate and refine Insights chatbots to align with real world research outcomes.
Continuously iterate and refine Innovation chatbots to drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Conduct thorough testing of chatbots to verify improvements.
Establish best practices for prompt Engineering and share with chatbot users.
Benchmark LLMs to evaluate relative performance for future use.
Assist with APIs and automations to connect chatbots to key business platforms.
Assist with data consolidation and organization to create a searchable innovation knowledge center.
Assist with the creation of the design Insights to Innovation platforms.
Performs other tasks as needed.


Qualifications


Highly organized; Detail Oriented; Resourceful; Adaptable; Proactive
Creative problem-solver with "can-do" attitude
Ability to work efficiently on multiple projects, under pressure and meet deadlines
Works well independently and in team situations
Demonstrated ability to communicate with, and collect information from colleagues
Expertise in workflow management and keen prioritization skills are a must
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Linguistics, or a related field.
Basic knowledge of Python
1-2 years of experience
Proficiency with LLMs, Ai programs and tools used for data analysis


_

Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

description:
The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for acquiring, managing and analyzing data that will be presented to internal teams, clients and partners. The Data Analyst leads the onboarding of electronic data trading partners and is responsible for the success of trading partner implementations. The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for monitoring client data submissions and communicating with them in the resolution of data quality issues.


Successful applicants will have experience with Excel


Pharmacy Claims experience is a huge plus

Requirements


Developing reports and analytics using Excel
Heavy Excel
Works with partners to help guide and assist in creating a data feed according to defined specifications
Proactively communicates with trading partners and clients to expedite their onboarding
Communicates directly with customer on data needs and key deadlines
Researches and identifies data quality issues reported through the trading partner or found through new file submission and work with client to create a resolution
Fields ongoing, incoming partner requests and questions regarding data specifications
Reviews files received for compliance with data needs, including testing files and identifying the business rules that will need to be configured in mapping tool
Configures mapping tool to support translation from source data to desired format. Includes testing of tool and providing clear documentation to internal resources and customer
Analyzes and communicates trading partner performance in their ability to meet data specifications in a timely and effective manner
Act as resident expert for data requirements/specifications internally and for the client
Communicates data needs to the trading partner both initially and after we begin to receive files for the customer
Researches, coordinates, and executes the transfer of new data feeds or data corrections with clients to ensure that continuity and level of service are maintained
Remain informed and up to speed with ongoing changes and evolution of data specs
Lead client/partner web-based trainings regarding data specifications and requirements



Qualifications:


Self-starter, an individual who is not fully dependent on direction to fulfill the functions of the role
Thrives in an entrepreneurial-like environment
Experience with ETL, analytic-based, data-driven, SSIS and Microsoft BI stack
Experience with Microsoft Excel and SQL is a must
Experience with healthcare and/or pharmacy data is preferred
Previous client-facing experience is a must
Must be extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency



Benefits


Supportive, progressive, fast-paced environment
Competitive pay structure
Matching 401(k) with immediate vesting
Medical, dental, vision, life, & short-term disability insurance

title: Data Insights Analyst ( remote )

description:
Building the Future of Crypto

Our Krakenites are a world-class team with crypto conviction, united by our desire to discover and unlock the potential of crypto and blockchain technology.

What makes us different?

Kraken is a mission-focused company rooted in crypto values. As a Krakenite, you’ll join us on our mission to accelerate the global adoption of crypto, so that everyone can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. For over a decade, Kraken’s focus on our mission and crypto ethos has attracted many of the most talented crypto experts in the world.

Before you apply, please read the Kraken Culture page to learn more about our internal culture, values, and mission.

As a fully remote company, we have Krakenites in 70+ countries who speak over 50 languages. Krakenites are industry pioneers who develop premium crypto products for experienced traders, institutions, and newcomers to the space. Kraken is committed to industry-leading security, crypto education, and world-class client support through our products like Kraken Pro, Kraken NFT, and Kraken Futures.

Become a Krakenite and build the future of crypto!

Proof of work

The team

Embark on a transformative journey with Kraken's Data Intelligence team, where your expertise will directly influence the evolution of the cryptocurrency landscape. Our team is not just a part of the organization; we are the central nerve of data-driven decision making, working in lockstep with Product, Marketing, Finance, and executive leadership to enhance business strategies and personalize user experiences.

At Kraken, data isn't just numbers; it's the compass that guides our entire operation. Your role will be crucial in unraveling complex user behaviors and navigating the intricate dynamics of the cryptocurrency ecosystem. You'll spearhead the development and refinement of pivotal north-star business metrics and elevate our reporting capabilities to new heights. Beyond traditional analytics, you will delve into the realms of meticulous statistical analysis and advanced machine learning models, all tailored to set new benchmarks in the industry.

Join us, and be part of a team where data is not just an asset; it's our language, our tool, and our future. At Kraken, we're as serious about data as the crypto world is about innovation.

The opportunity


Your analyses will inform our web3 & onchain products impacting the assets we list, their performance and liquidy
Translate onchain data findings into actionable strategies that bolster our customer acquisition efforts or product offerings
Drive continuous improvement initiatives by proactively monitoring product performance metrics and conducting in-depth analyses to identify areas for optimization.
Work closely with product, engineering, and marketing to spearhead projects that boost the user experience and health of our crypto investment ecosystem.
Act as a key advisor, providing insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making processes related to asset performance and optimizing key financial levers such as risk caps
Utilize data modeling and data engineering expertise to manage and analyze large internal datasets as well as onchain datasets.


Skills You Should HODL


You have 2+ years of professional experience working within the cryptocurrency ecosystem and financial markets.
Experienced Analyst: With 2+ years in the data analytics field, you're a pro with SQL, scripting languages (Python, R), data modeling and pipelining.
Statistically Minded: You have a firm grasp of statistical concepts and experience with BI software (Superset/Tableau).
Technologically Versatile: Experienced with data warehouse development and best practices, you're also eager to learn new technologies.
Clear Communicator: You can simplify complex data insights for anyone to understand, whether they're tech-savvy or not.
Additional Knowledge: Familiarity with data tools like Druid, Hadoop, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset is advantageous.


Nice-to-Haves


A BA/BS or MA/MS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Data Science is preferable.
Previous experience in onchain data analyses, surveying the cryptocurrency market


#USCANBRUKEU

This job is accepting ongoing applications and there is no application deadline.

Please note, applicants are permitted to redact or remove information on their resume that identifies age, date of birth, or dates of attendance at or graduation from an educational institution.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Kraken is powered by people from around the world and we celebrate all Krakenites for their diverse talents, backgrounds, contributions and unique perspectives. We hire strictly based on merit, meaning we seek out the candidates with the right abilities, knowledge, and skills considered the most suitable for the job. We encourage you to apply for roles where you don't fully meet the listed requirements, especially if you're passionate or knowledgable about crypto!

As an equal opportunity employer, we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

Stay in the know

Follow us on Twitter

Learn on the Kraken Blog

Connect on LinkedIn

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
Golden Customer Care is the human touchpoint for some of the largest health, wellness, beauty, and pet brands online. Through superior knowledge of our products and a drive to solve concerns quickly and thoroughly, we are able to maintain the highest levels of customer happiness and satisfaction.

We’re Looking For A(n): The Data Analyst is responsible for providing valuable insights and data-driven recommendations to support business decision-making. This role involves leveraging data analysis tools, statistical techniques, and business acumen to extract actionable insights from various data sources. The Data Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, design analytical solutions, and present findings to stakeholders.

Location: REMOTE (Alabama, Arizona, California, Georgia, New Mexico, Nevada, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, and Wyoming)

The Golden Difference. How are we different from other companies?


Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance for no cost on employee-only plans; 75% of premium coverage when enrolling dependents
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (You're part owner of GCC)
401k retirement contribution with company matching up to 3.5%
10 days of paid vacation, 6 days of paid sick time plus holidays
Massive room for professional growth and results-based pay increases
Actually fun virtual & in-person events


What You’ll Be Doing:


Utilize data mining, statistical analysis, and machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets from multiple sources. Extract relevant information and identify trends, patterns, and correlations that can provide valuable insights.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across various databases and data sources. Cleanse and preprocess data as needed to support accurate analysis.
Develop and implement predictive models to forecast future trends, customer behavior, or business outcomes. Use machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques to build reliable predictive models.
Work closely with the management team to understand their needs and requirements. Translate business questions into actionable analytical tasks and deliver solutions that address their specific needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to present data-driven insights in a clear and accessible manner. Use tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or other visualization platforms to create compelling data stories for the management team.
Ability to report information to the executive team.
Collaborate with management on ways to improve employee recognition/engagement and how we can track contest and incentives for various promotions going on.
Perform other related duties as assigned.


Preferred Qualifications (Note: These are preferred and not required. We strongly encourage you to apply even if you don’t tick ALL of these boxes.):


Demonstrated administrative assistant experience to senior level management
Strong attention to detail
Strong organizational and leadership skills.
Ability to prioritize responsibilities and perform multiple tasks with frequent interruptions
Must be able to cope with typical job stress
Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion
Manage priorities that are consistent with company goals
Ability to solve problems and work independently with minimal supervision.
Excellent interpersonal and team skills
Strong communication and Inclusive team player
Ability to follow through on requests and work assignments.
Writing, proofreading, and editing.
Ability to report findings to senior leadership
Cross departmental relationship building
Flexibility in day-to-day responsibilities
Develop leadership skills to others through coaching and mentorship
Utilize diversity amongst teams to create a positive working environment


The base salary for this position is $63,700-$106,200

Salary is based on a wide range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and geographical location.

title: Data Analyst

description:
Data & Business Analyst

Our client, an international manufacturer with a production facility in Markham, is seeking to hire a Data & Business Analyst. The is responsible for enhancing operational efficiencies and user experience through effective alignment of technology with business objectives. Acting as a liaison between business units and IT, the Analyst identifies improvement opportunities, analyzes business requirements, implements solutions, and ensures seamless application support.

We are looking for Data Analyst with intermediate or better SQL skills who is comfortable with data warehousing and can function as a junior DBA (maintenance, cleansing and integrity).

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with internal business units to understand and optimize national and cross-departmental processes.
Utilize advanced SQL skills for detailed process analysis, including data gathering, root cause analysis of production issues, and creation of insightful reports.
Facilitate communication among internal stakeholders, external partners, and developers to document business requirements.
Serve as the application subject matter expert, leveraging product knowledge to advocate for IT solutions that meet business needs.
Develop comprehensive business specifications and test cases, oversee User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Analyze Java, Cobol program sources, and SQL to support system enhancements and optimizations.
Establish and maintain standardized work processes and best practices.
Provide regular project status updates and gather feedback from business units.
Support training initiatives as needed.


Required Competencies:


Bachelor’s degree in computer science.
1-3 years of experience as a Business Analyst in distribution, Supply Chain, or Operations industries.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, with ability to write queries, understand database structures, and utilize SQL report servers.
1-3 years of experience in application support within a production environment.
Strong understanding of business processes in distribution, Supply Chain, or Operations industries.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Access/Data Warehouse, and PowerPoint.
Proven leadership in project management, with strong influencing and facilitation skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple concurrent tasks/projects.

description:
Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

Key Responsibilities:



Looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the program to ingest data from the Client's on premise and other data sources to Azure Data Lake


The role will work with Data Analysts to gather requirements, work with Client teams to gather requirements, create source to target data mapping, and create technical requirements documents


The analyst will also assist with integration and user acceptance testing


This is a customer facing role and candidates must have strong communication skills, pays attention to detail, has strong analytical skills, customer service, and ability to work independently



Basic Qualifications:



Minimum 3 years of experience with SQL, Power-BI, Azure Cloud, Agile Methodology, Azure DevOps


High School Diploma or GED



Preferred Qualifications:



Nice to Have Skills: Python, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS) Gen

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Data Analyst-MA

description:
About Quizlet

Inspired by our belief that anyone can learn anything and powered by our own curiosity, we build the smartest tools we can imagine to help students learn.

Quizlet is the popular, global learning platform and app that millions of students, teachers and everyday people use to study any subject imaginable for school, work or as part of their personal interests -- including two-thirds of high school students and half of all college students in the US. Combining cognitive science and machine learning, Quizlet guides students through adaptive study activities to confidently reach their learning goals. We’re on track to become the undisputed leader in user-generated learning content and engagement, at the scale of YouTube.

Valued at $1 billion, Quizlet has raised over $60 million in venture capital from investors including Icon Ventures, Union Square Ventures, General Atlantic, Costanoa Ventures, Owl Ventures, and Altos Ventures.

To serve our global community of learners, our teams tackle lofty technical challenges and design for use cases across cultures and languages. We work hard, act like owners, and collaborate every chance we get. We’re energized by the potential to power more learners through multiple approaches and various tools.

About The Team

The Analytics team at Quizlet leverages our rich data set to support data-driven decision making and insights throughout the company. The team collaborates with Data Engineering and Machine Learning teams in the broader Data organization.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, Operations, you will partner closely with our User Operations, Product Operations, Legal, Trust & Safety, and Security teams to support them with data-informed decisions and reporting on a variety of business needs. You will productionalize dashboards, provide quantitative insights and research from our vast array of data, and support reporting and ad hoc data needs from these teams. This is a dynamic role that will need to be prioritized across teams.

This is a hybrid role based out of our Denver, Los Angeles, New York, and San Francisco office hubs.

In This Role, You Will


Support a variety of teams with data-informed decisions and reporting


Some Example Projects Include


Creating dashboards to monitor our User Operations CSAT trends on different populations of users
Pull Quantitative data to support Product Operations insights on user pain-points
Extracting data reports for Legal research
Creating dashboards for Trust & Safety content moderation across our AI products
Investigating fraudulent user behavior and quantifying impact to the business
Deep-dive research on a particular business question


What You Bring To The Table


2+ years of experience in Data Analysis at a consumer internet company (Business Analyst, Fraud Analyst, Operations Analyst, Customer Analyst, Product Analyst, etc.)
Advanced SQL skills (CTEs, window functions, etc.) with strong Q&A ability
Proven experience creating and owning dashboards with user-based and event-based data
Ability to research and synthesize data insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Strong sense of ownership and impact for projects you are involved with
Ability to prioritize across multiple teams and projects
Strong communication with a variety of stakeholders
Experience working with one or more of the teams/domains (User Operations, Product Operations, Legal, Trust & Safety, Fraud & Security)


Bonus Points If You Have


Experience working with BigQuery and Periscope


Compensation, Benefits & Perks


Quizlet is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Salary transparency helps to mitigate unfair hiring practices when it comes to discrimination and pay gaps. Total compensation for this role is market competitive, including a starting base salary of $95,000 - $140,000, depending on location and experience, as well as company stock options
Collaborate with your manager and team to create a healthy work-life balance
20 vacation days (and we expect you to take them!)
Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance (100% employee and 75% dependent PPO, HMO, VSP Choice)
Employer-sponsored 401k plan with company match
Access to LinkedIn Learning and other resources to support professional growth
Paid Family Leave, FSA, HSA, Commuter benefits, Wellness benefits
40 hours of annual paid time off to participate in volunteer programs of choice


We strive to make everyone feel comfortable and welcome!

We work to create a holistic interview process, where both Quizlet and candidates have an opportunity to view what it would be like to work together, in exploring a mutually beneficial partnership.

We provide a transparent setting, that gives a comprehensive view of who we are!

In Closing

We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

We have a bias for action, take initiative, and take pride in delivering results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do.

We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

To All Recruiters And Placement Agencies

At this time Quizlet does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and/or profiles.

Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Quizlet employee. Quizlet will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm nor will it be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. All unsolicited resumes received will be considered the property of Quizlet.

THIS JOB DESCRIPTION DOES NOT ATTEMPT TO LIST ALL OF THE DUTIES THAT ARE OR MAY BE PERFORMED IN THIS POSITION

Primary Duties


Executes existing machine learning models in support of daily operations, long-term planning, and forecasting efforts. Reconciles actual and anticipated outcomes to identify discrepancies. Analyzes discrepancies by each component to isolate issues and enable continuous improvement.
Modifies existing plans and forecasts as necessary. Communicates adjustments to appropriate personnel. Identifies new data that could enhance the quality and accuracy of models to improve predictions.
Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Applies statistical and analytical methods to identify trends and dependencies. Generates operational insights and may make recommendations for addressing areas of opportunity.
Supports initiatives for data integrity and normalization. Utilizes various database platforms to collect data and complete the ad-hoc/root cause analysis of complex issues.
Participates in the development of reports. Presents information in a clear, consumable manner using data visualization tools and techniques.
Stays abreast of emerging and evolving data tools and technology.


Minimum Requirements

Educational/Experience Level

Bachelor's degree in MIS / Data Analytics, mathematics, engineering, statistics, or a related field and 1 year of relevant experience. Strong mathematical background with the ability to perform analysis involving statistical methods and regression analysis.

Preferred Skills

Knowledge of statistical computer language, data visualization and business intelligence tools.

Communication Skills

Requires the ability to communicate with internal and/or external customers in order to obtain and/or provide explanations and/or information on technical concepts to individuals with limited experience in or knowledge of the technical area.

Numeric Skills

Requires the ability to perform analyses involving ratios, percentages and simple statistical methods.

Computer Skills

Requires working knowledge of various software applications to create and maintain documents, reports, spreadsheets, and/or graphics.

WORK CONDITIONS:

Works in an indoor environment. Requires occasionally performing activities including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, grasping, reaching, twisting, turning and/or lifting.

title: Data Analyst

description:
UNCAGE YOUR AMBITION as a

Data Analyst

We are FlightHub Group , an ambitious team of people that created FlightHub and Justfly . Our brands have grown to become two of the top-ranked travel agencies in North America. We now serve over 3 million customers per year, totaling 3 billion dollars in sales, and, whereas the pandemic may have slowed us down a little, we are coming back even stronger. We dream big, pursue passionately, and follow through with resolute self-belief and rigorous commitment. We are a group of individuals sharing a common vision and values, having come together to pursue a collective mission: overtaking the #1 spot in the world.

We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our Customer Service department, who has strong analytical skills and experience in SQL, Excel, and Google Sheets. In this role, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and performing manual quality assurance (QA) tasks to validate data accuracy.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze data to generate insightful reports.
Develop strategies for conducting manual QA efficiently and ensuring data accuracy, quality, and completeness.
Generate comprehensive documentation of QA processes and findings.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure data integrity and consistency.


Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficient in SQL, with the ability to write complex queries and optimize them for performance.
Advanced skills in Excel, including the use of formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools.
Experience with Google Sheets, including functions and collaboration features.
Basic understanding of AI concepts and applications is required.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong communication skills to effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with statistical software and data analysis techniques is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.


Soft Skills


Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks.
Please note this position is in Montreal, Quebec and on-site


Show us your drive and join our team!

Check us out https://flighthubgroup.com/takeoff

LIBÉREZ VOTRE AMBITION – DEVENEZ

Analyste de données

Nous sommes le groupe FlightHub, nous formons une équipe ambitieuse derrière les agences de voyages en ligne FlightHub et Justfly. Nos marques sont devenues deux des agences de voyages en ligne les plus importantes en Amérique du Nord. Nous servons maintenant plus de trois millions de clients par année, et générons au-delà de trois milliards de dollars de ventes, et, même si la pandémie nous a un peu ralenti, l'industrie des voyages recommence à montrer des signes de vie, et le moment est propice pour vous joindre à nous parce que nous en profitons pour revenir encore plus forts. Nous rêvons en grand, nous poursuivons nos objectifs avec passion, et nous avons confiance en notre habilité à les atteindre.

Nous recherchons un analyste de données qualifié pour rejoindre notre service clientèle, qui possède de solides compétences analytiques et de l'expérience en SQL, Excel et Google Sheets. Dans ce rôle, vous serez responsable de l'interprétation des données, de l'analyse des résultats à l'aide de techniques statistiques et de l'exécution de tâches manuelles d'assurance qualité (QA) pour valider l'exactitude des données.

Principales Responsabilités


Collecter, traiter et analyser les données afin de produire des rapports pertinents.
Élaborer des stratégies pour mener efficacement des tâches manuelles d'assurance qualité et garantir l'exactitude, la qualité et l'exhaustivité des données.
Produire une documentation complète sur les processus et les résultats de l'assurance qualité.
Identifier, analyser et interpréter les tendances ou les modèles dans des ensembles de données complexes.
Collaborer avec la direction pour hiérarchiser les besoins en matière d'activités et d'informations.
Localiser et définir de nouvelles possibilités d'amélioration des processus.
Collaborer avec d'autres services pour garantir l'intégrité et la cohérence des données.


Qualifications


Expérience confirmée en tant qu'analyste de données ou dans un rôle similaire.
Maîtrise du langage SQL, avec la capacité d'écrire des requêtes complexes et de les optimiser en termes de performances.
Compétences avancées en Excel, y compris l'utilisation de formules, de tableaux croisés dynamiques et d'outils de visualisation de données.
Expérience de Google Sheets, y compris des fonctions et des fonctions de collaboration.
Une compréhension de base des concepts et des applications de l'intelligence artificielle est requise.
Solides compétences analytiques avec la capacité de collecter, d'organiser, d'analyser et de diffuser des quantités importantes d'informations avec le souci du détail et de l'exactitude.
Solides compétences en communication pour transmettre efficacement des données complexes à des parties prenantes non techniques.
Une bonne connaissance des logiciels statistiques et des techniques d'analyse des données est un atout.
Licence en informatique, en gestion de l'information, en statistiques ou dans un domaine connexe.


Compétences Non Techniques


Souci du détail et engagement en faveur de l'exactitude.
Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et capacité à faire preuve d'esprit critique.
Capacité à travailler de manière indépendante et en équipe.
Excellentes compétences en matière de gestion du temps et capacité à hiérarchiser les tâches.
Veuillez noter que ce poste est situé à Montréal, au Québec et sur place.

title: Data Analyst / Analyste de données

description:
Position Description

The incumbent will perform studies and analyses of administrative/management issues. Incumbent should be able to exercise analytic ability combined with a knowledge of the functions, processes and principles of management. Responsibilities often require the utilization and integration of skills in study organization, modeling, interviewing, research, statistical analysis and writing. The successful applicant will be able to analyze problems to identify significant factors, develop a plan of action, gather pertinent data, and recognize solutions. S/he should be able to develop and test hypotheses, utilizing the appropriate tools/tests (e.g., spreadsheets, surveys, focus groups, statistics, research, etc.), then document, validate, and report findings to higher level authority and serve as advisor or consultant to senior management. Position required the ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing; develop accurate, well-organized presentations and written reports; and be able to explain process, key points, and conclusions with the right amount of information for the audience.

Incumbent will be required to work independently as well as part of a team. The ability to work with and gather data from employees at all levels and from diverse backgrounds is a requirement. This position supports Headquarters and Business Unit by participating in study teams concerned with organizational analysis, assignment and implementation of functions, capital investments, cost reductions, and effective management. Position requires an understanding of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

$62,926

LOCATION: New York City (hybrid required, in-office 3 days/ week)

_______________________________________________________

Position Summary

The Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business goals by assisting in data analysis and report development. The responsibilities will include cleansing and analyzing data, crafting presentations, and contributing to strategic initiatives. This role involves working with various teams, documenting requirements, and communicating actionable insights.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities Of The Job


Generate dashboards, reports, and critical metrics by understanding the vision and gathering requirements
Maintain communication with the business on project statuses and issue resolution
Implement and track goals and initiatives, measure progress, metrics, KPIs, and return on investment
Maintain and grow knowledge of macro environment and associated business impact
Identify white space ideas and opportunities by conducting research

Capture and document business/technical requirements
Support change initiatives and strategies

External: Consumer partners (L1 & L2)

Decision Making


Must have strong influencing and communication skills
Able to consult disparate sources of data and information to make decisions


Resourcefulness/Creativity


Comfortable with all levels and cultures, relationship builder
Uses creativity in communication to clearly articulate written and visual messages; includes creative usage of Power Point to convey messages
Self-starter
Ability to engage externally with industry groups and partners
Has a highly developed sense of curiosity and problem solving


Environment


Ability to influence at all levels
Ability to work in ambiguity


Qualifications & Experience

2-3 years in data analytics (preferably consumer/ customer data analysis experience)
Experience in corporate retail is a plus

Experience with user-interface and front-end development
Familiarity with business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Solid understanding and use of Microsoft Office applications
Working knowledge of statistics
Ability to communicate sophisticated data in a simple, actionable way

Prior experience working with very large data sets


Education

Education:


BS/BA Degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Information Management etc.) or equivalent experience


Skills

Skills:


Excellent critical thinking, time management, analytical, and communication skills
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with a particular emphasis on the ability to make complex information both understandable and compelling
Ability to combine strong quantitative skills with excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Motivated and willingness to learn
Positive, solution-oriented, good work ethic


This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

This position requires 3 days working in office per week.

#hybrid

PVH currently provides base salary ranges for all positions-on job advertisements-in the United States based on local requirements. These ranges are based on what PVH reasonably believes that it will pay an associate for their base salary for said position at the time of the posting. title: Analyst, Data Science - PVH Corp

description:
We're seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our growing team! In this hybrid role, you'll collaborate across departments to collect,

analyze, and interpret data, empowering strategic decision-making throughout the organization.

What You'll Do

Partner with various teams to gather data from diverse sources, ensuring its accuracy and quality.

Craft clear and informative dashboards and reports to track key product metrics.

Develop repeatable, scalable data views to empower teams with self-service analytics.

Weave data from different sources into compelling narratives that drive informed choices.

Leverage statistical analysis and data visualization techniques to uncover trends, patterns, and valuable insights.

Build and maintain data models, databases, and reporting systems that support data-driven decisions.

Design charts, graphs, and visualizations that effectively communicate complex information.

Utilize predictive analytics to anticipate future trends and opportunities.

Clean, transform, and prepare data for analysis, safeguarding its integrity.

Integrate data from multiple sources and troubleshoot data-related challenges.

Implement and uphold data governance practices to ensure data accuracy, security, and compliance.

Partner with department heads and leadership to provide data-driven insights and recommendations.

What We're Looking For

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's degree a plus).

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.

Experience with financial planning and analytics is a plus.

Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI).

Strong understanding of data management and database systems (SQL, NoSQL).

Familiarity with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Impeccable attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.

Effective communication and presentation skills.

Ability to thrive in a collaborative environment and translate complex findings for non-technical audiences.

The Perks

Competitive salary range: $85,000 - $100,000 annually.

Hybrid work model: 3 days in office, 2 days remote (following probation).

Opportunity to make a real impact on a growing company!

Ready to join a team that values data-driven decision making? We look forward to hearing from you!

description:
Accenture Flex offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.

As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.

You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. Accenture Flex employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

Looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the program to ingest data from the Client's on premise and other data sources to Azure Data Lake

High School Diploma or GED

Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here

title: Data Analyst - 5292775

description:
We are offering a $1,000.00 sign on bonus!

We are seeking to hire a full time (35 hours per week) Data Analyst to join our Continuous Quality Improvement team. The Data Analyst is directly responsible for the successful implementation of quality management and quality improvement activities on both the programmatic and organizational levels in response to identified data findings, or expectations established by regulatory and funding agents.

The responsibilities for this position include the following:


Assist leadership personnel to interpret, use and respond to data including Stakeholder Feedback, Outcome Data, Risk Management, and Utilization and Case Record Review findings. This includes oversight and mentoring of program level Quality Management meetings.
Assist in policy and procedure review, update and development by continually assessing for opportunities for improvement, reporting observations and findings from Stakeholder involvement activities by conducting research with community, state, federal and accrediting resources and identifying policies in need of review.
Monitor data collected through Stakeholder Feedback, Risk Management, and Utilization Review and Case Record Review to identify opportunities for future quality improvement initiatives.
Assist Director of Quality Improvement to gather and report data relevant to the Agency’s Quality Management Plan and other Quality Improvement initiatives in keeping with the department’s established reporting calendar.
Assist the Director of Quality Improvement with accreditation (and licensing as appropriate) preparation and implementation activities.
Coordinates and conducts internal program reviews and compliance audits as requested by Leadership and the Director of Quality Improvement.
Assist with Administrative Quality Council including scheduling meetings, distributing materials and member assignments, maintaining minutes and chairing meetings in the absence of Director of Quality Improvement.
Assist with completing department level projects when needed.
Collects and synthesizes data related to each departments Performance Improvement Targets.


Education and Experience:


Must have a minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in related field.
At least 2 years of experience with quality improvement activities for an agency or corporation.
Experience working with outcome data required.
Excellent organizational, written and oral communication skills required.
Must have demonstrated computer skills.
Proficient with Microsoft Suite (Excel and Access).
Experience working with JCAHO, CARF, or COA preferred. **


This is a benefits eligible position. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:


Medical, dental, vision insurance
Long term disability insurance
Life insurance
403b pension plan
Flexible spending account
Three weeks paid vacation
Twelve paid holidays
Generous earned sick time

This agency is a leading provider of professional social services in the South Coast region of Massachusetts, with a 135-year tradition of high quality.

Family Service Association is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Make a difference and join our team today!

title: Data Analyst - Entry Level

description:
Hi, we're TechnologyAdvice.

At TechnologyAdvice, we pride ourselves on helping B2B tech buyers manage the complexity and risk of the buying process. We are a trusted source of information for tech buyers, delivering advice and facilitating connections between our buyers and the world's leading sellers of business technology.

Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we are a remote-first company with more than 20 digital publications and over 500 global team members in the US, UK, Singapore, Australia, and the Philippines. We're proud to have been repeatedly recognized as one of America's fastest growing private companies by Inc., as well as a Tennessee top workplace. We work hard each day and have fun, too, with monthly virtual events, recreational slack channels, and the occasional costumed dance from our CEO.

All positions are open to remote work unless otherwise specified in the requirements below.

The opportunity

The Human Resources Data Analyst is a key player in our mission to hire, engage, retain, and grow the best and brightest team at TechnologyAdvice. In this role, you'll collaborate with our diverse HR team to design and implement cutting-edge reporting solutions, analyze complex data, and provide insightful recommendations that shape our employee engagement strategies. You'll not only enhance your skills but also contribute to a dynamic organization committed to innovation and excellence in human resources.

Location: United States

What you'll do


Design, construct and implement standard reporting solutions based on Paylocity and other HR applications
Provide insight on complex questions around reporting, dashboards and benchmarking, reconciling data from multiple sources and considering the key aspects of data management
Produce analysis and visualizations through technologies such as Looker or Tableau
Analyze perks and benefits utilization and performance against budgets
Manage and maintain standardized reporting and dashboards for specific audiences, monitoring usage, evaluating value added, and driving continuous improvements
Create, analyze, and deploy banding and leveling across roles, regions, and teams related to job competencies and compensation
Maintain strict confidentiality of department and employee information
Track and interpret trending directions for data analytics and identify potential future options
Maintain strong business relationships with key stakeholders to keep on the pulse of what is important to leadership and build relevant analysis and interpretation


Who you are


Agile professional who excels in a fast-paced environment and thrives on continuously pivoting strategies to drive business needs forward
Background and proven track record in Human Resources Business Intelligence and/or advanced HR reporting (workforce reporting, recruiting, learning, performance management and overall people data)
Knowledge and experience with Tableau, Looker, BigQuery, Visual Basic (VBA) scripts, Google App Scripts, and proficiency with HR technology
Experience reading and writing structured query language (SQL)
Proactive consulting skills that drive business impact; able to interpret business requirements and co-create the most relevant & pragmatic approach
Well-versed with related market trends, leading practices, services, and solutions
Strong project management skills with the ability to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously, resource requirements, and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and collaboration skills


What we offer you

Our benefits and programs are designed to make your life better for you and your family...


Flexible schedule with remote, hybrid and on-site options
Comprehensive medical, dental and vision insurance
401K with company matching
Flexible paid time off
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Pet insurance for your furry family members and co-workers
Wellness perks that include the Headspace App and monthly fitness reimbursements
Ongoing career development opportunities, mentorship program, bucket list benefit, and more
In-office snacks, beverages, catered meals, and even some ping pong


Work authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire in an employer approved US state and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

Salary Range

TechnologyAdvice seeks to hire top-tier individuals across the world and intends for our compensation to be at a rate that allows us to recruit and retain individuals who align with our core values, purpose, mission, and vision.

Final total compensation is based on a multitude of factors including, but not limited to, skill level, relevant experience to the position, and cost of labor.

Annual pay range

$75,000—$85,000 USD

EOE statement

We believe that our differences make us stronger, and thus foster a diverse and inclusive culture where people feel safe being themselves. TechnologyAdvice is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law.

Pre-employment screening required.

TechnologyAdvice does not engage with external staffing agencies. Any candidates introduced by such firms will not be eligible for compensation.

Any AI-generated or incomplete application answers will be auto-rejected.

description:

The Analyst I, Data will be responsible to create, process, and maintain a portfolio of Master Data elements in support of the Operations Organization. Cares/passionate about work
Organized and detail oriented

description:
This is a remote position.

Data BI Analyst (1 year experience, remote)

Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process.

Hiring Type: Full-Time

Base Salary: $58K-$68K Per Annum.

Are you a talented BI Analyst with a passion for data analysis and a strong background in business intelligence? We are seeking a skilled and motivated individual to join our team as a BI Analyst. As a BI Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, generating insights, and providing actionable recommendations to drive business growth and efficiency.

Responsibilities:


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and provide actionable recommendations.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.


Requirements:


Bachelor's Degree required with an emphasis in business, economics, math, engineering, or analytics preferred. Advanced degree or certification preferred.
1+ years of experience, with at least 1 year of analytic experience.
Proficiency in interacting with various database and file storage systems (Examples: Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL). Understanding of join types.
Experience with data manipulation languages, such as SQL, required.
Knowledge of statistical concepts and analytic techniques, including descriptive statistics, forecasting, economic modeling, exploratory analysis, and variance analysis required.
Ability to perform univariate analytic analytical techniques.
Experience using Microsoft Excel, including the use of pivot tables, formulas, macros, VBA, charts/graphs.
Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, or QlikView.
Strong analytical, critical, and systems thinking required.


Skills:


Good understanding of Agile framework (SCRUM).
Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus.


Benefits:


Competitive salary based on skills, qualifications, and experience 1.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.
Retirement program with lifetime pension benefits.
Paid time off and holidays.
Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.

title: Data Analyst - Nationwide

description:
Job Location Washington, DC

Telework Eligible Yes, at least 3 days per week in-person reporting at Washington, DC office.

Remote Eligible No

Summary Statement

The Global Health Training, Advisory and Support Contract (GHTASC) delivers effective global health programming to advance the mission of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), Bureau for Global Health (GH) through institutional support and workforce development services from junior, mid-level, senior and expert advisory and administrative professionals.

Credence and its partner, the Public Health Institute (PHI), are both employers for GHTASC, and are seeking a Junior Data Analyst under GHTASC. This position will be hired under Public Health Institute (PHI).

The Bureau for Global Health (GH) provides essential technical leadership and support on global health issues to Agency leadership, USAID Missions, other USAID Bureaus and Independent Offices (B/IOs), and others in the global health community. The Office of the Assistant Administrator, commonly referred to as the GH “Front Office,” provides oversight for all Global Health programs, support to the field, research, legislative relations, and external affairs. More information on the Bureau for Global Health can be found here.

Position Summary

The Junior Data Analyst will provide technical support in conducting advanced analytics to better inform health programming through complex relationships with and between global health program and performance data and country-specific or survey data. The Junior Data Analyst will work closely with technical program experts at USAID Headquarters and Missions in the development and execution of data analyses and visualizations. The Junior Data Analyst will be an essential member of the GH Front Office and reports on a day-to-day basis to the Front Office’s Senior Data Advisor.

Full salary range for this position is $65,260 to $94,640 per year, with the starting salary determined based on candidate’s knowledge, skills, experience, as well as budget availability.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities


Support with data analysis and visualization of global health program monitoring and evaluation (M&E) data for all GH priority health areas, as well as other global health data from public sources, to inform strategic discussions about the direction of global health programming.
Participate in discovery processes with GH leadership team and stakeholders to identify requirements and expected outcomes for new or existing initiatives, including how to measure success.
Work with the Senior Data Advisor and Senior Data Scientist, as well as with data experts from across GH, to build, maintain and/or enhance systems and tools that generate sophisticated data visualizations and communicate clear strategic messages for the GH Front Office.
Communicate results of analyses through data visualizations that adhere to visualization standards and best practices, using tools best fitting to the purpose (such as R, Tableau, Excel, and Adobe Illustrator).
Support extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources.
Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insights.
Contribute to the publication of original research articles.
Support project management with GH Bureau implementing partners.
Work at least 3 days per week in-person at Washington, DC office.
Travel internationally and domestically up to 2 trips a year.
Perform other duties as assigned.



Qualification Requirements

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Minimum Qualifications


Master’s degree with 1 year of relevant experience, bachelor’s degree with 3 years of relevant experience, Associate’s degree and 5 years of relevant experience, or High School graduate and 7 years of relevant experience.
US Citizenship or US Permanent Residency with the ability to obtain and maintain a Facility Access clearance is required. For Permanent Residents, this means having resided in the US for at least 3 of the past 5 years.



Other Qualifications


Master’s degree in computer science, information systems, data science, analytics, statistics, economics, public health, biostatistics, epidemiology, social science, mathematics, or relevant field preferred.
Experience in data management and visualization, preferably in Global/Public Health, with experience with at least one data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Working knowledge and experience using one of statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, Stata, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Experience using web services such as S3 and ETL skills are plus.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis, visualization, and presentation of data.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
A self-starter mentality comfortable working both independently and collaboratively.
Demonstrated experience working with large data sets, survey dataset experience is a plus.
Ability to travel domestically and internationally up to 2 trips a year.
Ability to work at least 3 days per week in-person at Washington, DC office.



Competencies


Innovation Takes initiative to propose new ideas/approaches and demonstrates ability to find new and better ways to accomplish work.
Client Service Communicates with clients, handling any issues politely and efficiently; understands and is available to clients; maintains pleasant and professional image.
Accountability Takes ownership of work responsibilities and holds high standards. Keeps commitments and takes appropriate actions to ensure obligations are met. Pursues efficiency and effectiveness and adheres to organization policies and procedures.
Interpersonal Skills Works in cooperation with others and communicates effectively with co-workers, supervisors, subordinates, clients, and other outside contacts.
Continual Learning Assesses and recognizes own strengths and weaknesses; pursues professional development that is aligned with organizational role, contribution, and goals; proactively shares knowledge with others to foster learning across the organization.



Prior to submitting your application, your resume must include relevant paid and non-paid experience showing dates held with month, year and hours worked per week for each position. Please ensure that all relevant experience and education is documented on your resume. There is no limitation to resume length; updates to resumes will not be accepted during the interview and selection process.

title: Junior Data Analyst

description:
Who We Are

Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing (SMS) is one of America’s top-five non-bank mortgage-servicing companies. What is mortgage servicing? Our clients are businesses that own mortgage loans (such as banks and real estate investment firms). On their behalf, we manage (or “service”) their loan portfolios, which means that we collect homeowners’ mortgage payments, pay their tax and insurance bills, and help homeowners in default to get current.

Primary Function

The Escrow Data Analyst is responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving both current and future reporting needs for the business units. The individual will produce collaborative content for reports, analysis dashboards, and other initiatives. In addition, the Escrow Data Analyst will provide support on statistical methodology and analysis. The individual must be proficient with Excel and SQL.
